1. Installation and Requirements

Prerequisites

The dynamic-community-fba package relies on the CBMPy library [1] for handling constraint-based metabolic models. Like COBRApy, CBMPy is a Python package that simplifies the creation, loading, and manipulation of constraint-based models, allowing interaction with LP-solvers like CPLEX [2].

To install CBMPy, you can use the following command:

pip install cbmpy

For more information and detailed documentation on using CBMPy, please refer to the CBMPy GitHub repository and the CBMPy documentation.

Dynamic Community FBA

After the installation of CBMPY you can install dynamic community FBA using the following command

pip install NAME

Escher

Maybe we can write some easy converter functions for known maps. To display the models have to think about this

[1]

PySCeS Constraint Based Modelling (http://cbmpy.sourceforge.net) Copyright (C) 2010-2023 Brett G. Olivier, Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam, Amsterdam, The Netherlands

[2]

IBM (2017) IBM ILOG CPLEX 12.7 User’s Manual (IBM ILOG CPLEX Division, Incline Village, NV).1
